channel.title: Local Obituaries from WQOW.com and Tributes.com
channel.description: Obituaries and Online Obituaries News at Tributes.com. Find Local and National Obituaries News and Personal Tributes. Read Obituaries, Death and Funeral Notices, and Create Obituaries for Loved Ones.

item.title: Kevin Flettre, Boyceville, Wisconsin
item.description: Kevin Leo Flettre, age 53, of Boyceville, passed away Monday, March 11, 2013 at Mayo Clinic Health System-Eau Claire surrounded by his family. Kevin was born on November 23, 1959 to Darold and Agnes (Colburn) Krusemark near Omaha, NE on the Air force base. He later moved to Turtle Lake, WI with his mother and step-dad Irvin Flettre. He was a graduate of Turtle Lake High School. On April 22, 1989 he married Carleen Swenson in Atwater, MN. They lived in and around the Twin Cities area...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Patty Ann Kadinger, 61, Menomonie, Wisconsin
item.description: Patty Ann Kadinger, age 61 of Menomonie, WI died Friday, March 8, 2013 at her daughters home in Menomonie after a battle with cancer. She was born December 13,1951 in River Falls, Wisconsin to Robert & Deloris (Olson) Stabenow. Patty had many jobs over the years, but the best was the last several years when she cared for her grandchildren. Her grandkids meant the world to her! She loved to camp and go fishing; mainly at Moon Lake near Turtle Lake, WI and the grandchildren would join her...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Rosalie D. (Anderson) Retzloff, 74, Wheeler, Wisconsin
item.description:
Rosalie D. (Anderson) Retzloff, age 74 of Wheeler, WI died Wednesday, March 6, 2013 at The Area Nursing Home in Colfax, WI.
Rosalie was born August 13, 1938 in Otter Creek Township to Arnold and Sheila (Andrews) Anderson and resided the majority of her life in that area.
Rosalie graduated from Colfax High School. Prior to her retirement Rosalie had many work experiences including: Mayo Clinic, Rochester MN, Honeywell, St. Paul MN, Sandy Lee Manufacturing, Menomonie, and enjoyed working...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Viola Wendt-Schmidt, 88, Merrill, Wisconsin
item.description: Viola C. Wendt-Schmidt, age 88, of Merrill, passed away Monday, March 4, 2013 at Artisan Assisted Living formerly known as Walnut Grove Assisted Living. She was born November 17, 1924 in Merrill to the late Carl & Paulina (Braun) Schulz. She married Raymond Wendt in Merrill on November 16, 1946. He preceded her in death October 7, 1978. She later married Wilbert Schmidt in Wausau. He also preceded her in death. Viola was the youngest of 12 children. She grew up on the family farm in the town...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Sylvester Hilson, Menomonie, Wisconsin
item.description: Sylvester Hilson, age 95, of Menomonie, WI passed away Saturday, March 2, 2013 at the Dunn County Health Care Center in Menomonie, with his family by his side. He was born May 15, 1917 in Eau Claire, WI and grew up in the North Running Valley community near Colfax. Sylvester attended Running Valley School and Colfax High School. In 1938 he moved to Menomonie, with his parents, Carl and Nora (Anderson) Hilson and five sisters. He farmed with his father until 1944, when he and his wife...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Virginia Hintzman, 97, Menomonie, Wisconsin
item.description: Virginia M. Hintzman, age 97 of Menomonie, WI died Friday, March 01, 2013 at Dunn County Health Care Center in Menomonie. Virginia was born July 24, 1915 in Minnesota. She was a high school graduate and became a "bookkeeper" with Montgomery Ward Stores and upon retiring, became a homemaker. She was married to Victor Hintzman and he died in 1991. She was a member of the Homemakers Club, and active in Peace Lutheran Church and the Women's Clubs at Peace Lutheran. When her husband passed,...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Rosalyn Boser, 93, Marathon, Wisconsin
item.description: Rosalyn Boser, age 93, passed away peacefully on Saturday, March 9, 2013 under the wonderful care of Aspirus Comfort Care and Hospice Services. She was greeted by an angel, Katie Hart, who was her best friend and niece. She was born March 12, 1919, in the town of Frankfort, daughter of the late George and Catherine (Kipp) Ellenbecker. On June 13, 1939 she married Joseph Boser at St. John Catholic Church, Wuertzburg. He survives. After retiring from Marathon Cheese, Rosalyn enjoyed...

item.title: Marion Bertina Heitkamp, 83, Menomonie, Wisconsin
item.description: Marion Bertina Heitkamp Marion Bertina Heitkamp, age 83 of Menomonie, WI died Friday, March 08, 2013 at Mayo Clinic Health System-Menomonie. Marion was born April 28, 1929 in Menomonie, Wisconsin the daughter of Herman & Bernice (Coleman) Henderson. She attended Colfax Schools through her junior year and graduated from Menomonie High School in 1946. She then attended one year at The University Of Wisconsin-Stout. She married Fred "Fritz" Heitkamp at Tainter Evangelical United Brethern...

item.title: Glenn A. Sebby, 93, Lac du Flambeau, Wisconsin
item.description: Glenn A. Sebby, age 93, of Lac du Flambeau, passed away on Wednesday, March 6, 2013 at Our Home K-Care in Lac du Flambeau. He was born on August 17, 1919 in Plainfield, IL, the son of Arthur and Rose Sebby. Glenn was a proud Veteran of the United States Navy. He served in the Navy from 1943-46 during World War II, aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. On May 16, 1996 he married Patricia Hrabik. Glenn was a member of the American Legion Post 89 of Minocqua and enjoyed hunting, fishing, music and...

item.description: Thomas J. Kloehn, 78, of Minocqua passed away at UW Hospitals in Madison on Wednesday, March 6, 2013. (nee Ashenbrenner) on January 7, 1956 in Gresham, WI at St. Francis Church. He retired in 1990 as an Industrial Motor Salesmen for the G.E. Co and moved to Minocqua. Tom was an active member of Rock of Ages Lutheran Church in Minocqua. He...

item.title: Orvald Thompson, Boyceville, Wisconsin
item.description: Orvald Thompson passed away March 1st, 2013 with his family around him at Luther Hospital in Eau Claire, WI. Orvald (Orv) was born in Eddy County North Dakota on November 15th, 1931 to Oscar and Elsie (Soderstrom) Thompson. Orvald, the second of 4 children to Oscar and Elsie had 3 siblings- Alden, Marvin (Buddy), and Ardis (Sis). Orvald spent his early years working on his parent's farm in North Dakota where they raised Winter Wheat and Rye as well as operated a dairy farm which...
